description:
In filter/disk_filter.py, we use the the whole free disk on the host to caculate, But I think we need to use the free disk for store in stance here.  
Example, the whole free disk may be 100G on the host, but in /var/lib/nova/instances/ the free disk  may only have 10M, I think that we should use this 10M  in this filter, not 100G.
title: schedule disk_filter issue

comments.content:
In filter/disk_filter.py, we use the the whole free disk on the host to caculate, But I think we need to use the free disk for store in stance here.  
Example, the whole free disk may be 100G on the host, but in /var/lib/nova/instances/ the free disk  may only have 10M, I think that we should use this 10M  in this filter, not 100G.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~maoliping455

comments.content: Actually, the source code use the os.statvfs(CONF.instances_path) to get the disk's information if the libvirt_images_type is not ‘lvm’,  so what you get from host_state.free_disk_mb is not the whole free disk of the host, only the specified disk!

comments.content: It sounds like we expect this to work as you desire.   Can you add some more information if you think this isn't working properly?

comments.content: Honestly, I'm pretty sure this works as you expect. Unless you can provide a reproduce scenario where it doesn't, I'm not sure there is anything to fix here.
